name: Richmond Hotel

reviews.title: Decent for the price
reviews.text: We stayed at the Richmond Hotel from 7/2-7/7. I have stayed at probably 50 hotels in the last year and I would place this one right in the middle. I paid only $87/night through Hotwire so that makes my expectations a little less than if i stayed at the Ritz Carlton or Loews. The room had no drawer space but was furnished just like any other hotel. Anyone who complains about small stains on the carpet and chair has to realize that it is a beach hotel so people are probably putting their sandy towels and bathing suits on the floor or chairs...which explains the stains. I found the staff to be courteous and prompt. The grounds were in good shape and the location was perfect as it was not as loud as many complain about. I did hear a couple having sex through the wall but they probably heard us too and aren't we adults afterall? I would highly recommend the hotel for under $100 a night...but remember you get what you pay for and dont expect Ritz Carlton quality when paying Super 8 prices people.

reviews.title: loved it
reviews.text: Stayed at the richmond, on south beach we loved it, one of the best hotels iv stayed in and i have traveled all around the world. the beach backs on to the bottom of the hotel, lovely looking grounds, pool really nice. Its in great location. lodes of trips on offer but you do need to ask at reception for the list of trips. The hotel is very glam, very clean. I would stay here again.

reviews.title: nice hotel
reviews.text: this was a nice hotel. not the lowes, but a nice simple hotel. the rooms were very clean but small. the bed was excellent. the beach area was VERY nice with only a small walk to the sand. the pool was very nice with a nice hot tub. the staff was very nice and helpful. the walls were very thin, i could hear the couple next door having sex like it was in my room. that was no big problem, it was over in a minute. if you want a nice hotel in a great location this is it. if your looking for perfection, shine and sparkle spend your money elsewhere. for the money you cant beat it!

reviews.title: Richmond Hotel From hell
reviews.text: Memorial Day weekend my girlfriends and I stayed at the Richmond hotel and from beginning to end it was a disaster. The staff was very unprofessional and rude. Our dissatisfaction began with the suprise $300 credit card hold/charge for incedentials such as phone use, valet parking, breakfast etc., which we were afforded none! The rooms were below poverty and the bathroom facility was disgusting!!!! The housekeeping service was horrible and very unfriendly. I will be writing a letter to management because they were unavailable this particular weekend to advise them of our dissatifaction. Anyone looking to stay in South beach should definately BEWARE of THE RICHMOND HOTEL....... I WILl NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN.

The wife & I recently stayed 3 nights at the Richmond. It was our 4th visit/stay in South Beach in the past 3 years. We have also visited like 12 of the South Beach Hotels while in Miami just to check them out for future trips. Previously we stay at the Shore Club and at the Bentley. The Richmond is not even close to being of the same caliber as those 2 Hotels. Of course the price is less at the Richmond.
reviews.title: Could be great if only...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paid 140 euros per night. Rooms were very clean! Staff was excellent... Fabio at the front desk was very nice!!! Great location, a block away from the colleseum and roman forum right across the street. Free continental breakfast on the rooftop was SWEET... fresh fruit, buns, cheese, meat, pound cake, cereal! Nice the hotel washroom provided body wash and shampoo too!
reviews.title: Nice hotel... great location

likes.liked: — friendly staff and rooftop breakfast was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel to be an excellent large city hotel. Breakfasts on the rooftop dining area were filling and lovely. Rooms were moderate sized. The proximity to various Roma attractions was good. We would return.
reviews.title: La Dolce Vita

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prices are too high for 2 stars and such service. Breakfast was good, but there is no restaurant in the hotel. The minibar in the room was nearly empty and when we asked if it's possible to order another coca-cola in our room, the answer was "no, sorry". Promised wireless internet didn't work, also air condition works in a very particular way.. By the way, in the shower I found little black bugs, that is really the most horrible. Doubtfully would recomend this hotel for someone.. and for sure will never come back there again. There is only one plus - really good central location, but there are a lot of other hotels around, it's better to choose something else.
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed this delightful hotel for 2 nights in July. The staff was friendly and helpful. Their English was fluent and they answered our many questions from shoe shopping to getting us a taxi. The breakfast was better than most in Italy, croissants, fruit, cheese, cereal, yogurt, cold meat ,fresh juices and the best view in the whole city. The room was spacious with very good quality bed linens. We will stay here again for all of the above reasons plus the location is perfect. The pizza place just out the front door is also recommended by us. We ate there twice, great food, fair prices.
reviews.title: Loved The Richmond
Lovely hotel and staff, but...
reviews.text: Couldn't fault the hotel. Helpful, friendly, courteous, pleasant, etc, etc. Rooms basic but spotless. Loads of reasonably priced and excellent restaurants, trattoria, etc just outside the front door. Breakfast very good and with lovely view of Roman Forum and Basilica of Maxentius. We had a fabulous visit - BUT - they almost ruined it all on the way home! We requested a taxi to take us to the airport (in the same way we had requested several taxis during our stay). The young man on reception did not request the same taxi firm as had been hired before, but a private cab. The lady driver refused to give us a price for the journey and claimed she did not understand our attempts to ask for a price, which soon changed once we arrived at the airport... Journey cost us nearly DOUBLE our journey to the hotel. Lesson: book a taxi yourself or get the bus!

reviews.title: Hotel was ok, will i go back...
reviews.text: My husband and I went to South Beach for a little get away. We stayed at the Richmond Hotel which was very nice. It was clean and the staff was so nice. Pool was beautiful and the grounds were just as nice. If you're looking for a soda machine or a snack machine, it's not there. There was a fridge in the room. Walgreens was right down the street so you could get drinks and snacks there.

reviews.title: a great spot
reviews.text: As far as stuff to do, ask the front desk. They were very helpful finding something fun to do.

reviews.title: Loved the Richmond
reviews.text: Will we go back to South Beach? Probably not. It wasn't what we thought it would be.

reviews.title: The worst hotel in miami beach
reviews.text: stayed at the richmond this past wknd 1/12,1/13/06. for what i paid $89.00 thru travelzoo, i found it to be one of the best bargains i have ever enjoyed.. the rooms r small, but the bed was heavenly, the pool, the hot tub were excellent. right where u want to be, 3 blocks from lincoln ave, and oh yeah the beach is out the back door.....
We arrived at the Richmond on September 4 for one night.
reviews.title: Don't be fooled!

reviews.text: Pros: Location, location, location: Walk past the pool and jacuzzi at the back, and you have direct access to the beach between 17th & 18th. I got the package at hotwire.com, so the price was very reasonable. Shower was hot and strong. Bed was medium-soft and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Location Right on the Beach, No-Frills Room with minimal style
ok
reviews.text: Cons:

I was thinking of staying a few extra nights, but their regular weekly room rates seemed a little high for a hotel of this quality. This was during Spring Break time, though. Nothing in the mini-bar, Decor was average-carpet tiles were tacky (clean) and the laminate was peeling off the custom art-deco inspired furniture. Bathroom toilet was too close to wall, sort of old bath fixtures. Walls were very thin-I could hear the guy next door on his cell phone clearly. I had to call 3 times to get fresh towels delivered to the room, because housekeeping goes home at 8pm?
reviews.title: Satisfied...
The way they show gratitude to return customers
reviews.text: Bottom Line:

The hotel is no-frills, but offers the basics-It's right on the beach, so throw your flip flops and bathing suit on, head to the beach, explore Miami's Lincoln Road, Espanol Way, and all the nightlife, because there's not much to look at in the room.
reviews.title: Average Hotel
Excellent Service, Great Location
reviews.text: The Richmond Hotel takes great care of its guests. I arrived at the hotel with my wife and two teenage sons after just being scammed by a Rome taxi out of about 60 Euros. I mentioned this to Rosa while checking in and she asked if I had the number of the taxi, which I did. A few hours later, I learned that Rosa had tracked down the driver. The next day, the driver came to the hotel and returned the 60 Euro he owed me plus the cost of the cab ride. Rosa is a gem.

reviews.title: what a great hotel
reviews.text: The hotel itself is in a very great location (next to the Roman Forum and a block from the Coliseum) and my room (102) was clean, quiet and comfortable for the four of us. The breakfast was very good and the rooftop location was a real treat.

Having stayed twice at this hotel, one would assume they would respond to 2 emails regarding a possible discount for airline employees which had been offered on our first stay. Nothing received even though I would have liked to have booked at a regular price. This only shows KAREN could care less about customer service. Then again, each stay, which may well have been Jan and/or Feb of 2001-2002 or 3, required us to BEG for them to cash American Travelers checks. GO FIGURE! Like Miami is still in the USA !!!!!!! It is a very nice hotel, but their customer service SUCKED each time we stayed, and looks like it still does. So on we go to another hotel, where we can be treated like human beings, instead of chattel. Oh, even a personal letter to the owner went unanswered. So no need to wonder why their customer service sucks.
reviews.title: Stayed Twice: 2002, 2003
The Richmond Hotel, South Beach
reviews.text: My wife and I escaped to South Beach this past week, April 21, 2005 - April 27, 2005 for a little "R&R." South Beach is an unusal destination for us because of our love for seclusion and tranquility found on many of the islands we have traveled over the years. (This is not our first trip to South Beach, I have worked in Miami on several occassins and we vacationed there several years ago.) Nevertheless we ventured off to South Beach. We utilized an internet travel agency and came up with the Richmond nicely located on Collins Avenue right in the heart of the large hotels. After being greated by a very professional front desk clerk, the highlight of the stay, we quickly learned that the Richmond only had location going its way. We were greeted by workman immediately outside our window making some type of repair and speaking very loudly. Towels were unavailable at the pool due to the fact that the poolside bar/restaurant had closed for the day (3:00 pm) and the cook gives out the towels or housekeepping forgot to bring the supply to the cook. (It is always nice to come in from the beach around 3:00 pm from a long day on the beach for a nice drink, unfortunately that is the time it closes.) Our first night we realized the meanning of paper thin walls. Our neighbor was having some type of personal problem, which I could tell you word-for-word but then this would not be published, with someone he apparently cared for, this went on for two nights. Oh yeah, he was talking with them over a cell phone with radio capabilities so we could hear both sides of the conversation. There were no amenties, other than an overpriced breakfast bar (even of South Beach), a spa that was broken unless you wished to blow in the activation tube where a button at one time worked in the place of your breath. At night, if you wanted a drink from the front porch bar you had to tear the bartender away from his buddies sitting at a nearby table, this was a terrible inconvenience for him. Finally, the straw that broke the camel's back was our third night there. The neighbor either resolved his problenm or checked out, however, at a little before 8:00 am the workmen who greated us on Friday when we arrived were back at their repair outside our window on Monday. We were gone before 10:00am. Overall, the stay at the Richmond was a disaster and I would avoid it all costs, no matter how great a rate you were offered.

reviews.title: Just like home if you happen to live in a classic mansion on Miami Beach
reviews.text: I'd be willing to bet the whiners who've written negative reveiws of The Richmond never stayed at a hotel they couldn't find more to complain about than to compliment. We must have been the ones making the noise in the rooms because nobody else bothered us. We had such a great time on the beach, in the shops and in the restaurants that we spent very little time in the room, and if we weren't making noise we were dead asleep on the unbelievably comfortable bed.

reviews.title: The Richmond & Richard A Great Combination
reviews.text: We enjoyed the service very much. That's not to say we were waited on hand and foot and had every need satisfied even before we knew we had the need. Rather, the staff was perfectly helpful when we asked for help, but otherwise left us alone. Expect to be treated like family at the Richmond. You wouldn't expect family to fall all over themselves waiting on you every minute. Frankly, I find that annoying.

reviews.title: Great Location, Lovely Room
reviews.text: The Richmond is well kept and in good condition inside and out. In fact the day we left, they had fixed the washroom door near the exercise room and were painting the exterior. Whiners might complain "the bathroom near the exercise room was out of service for two whole days and I had to walk 50 feet to the one in the cabana." I'd rather experience the warmth and history of this classic old hotel, even if there were a thing or two that needed fixing, than to stay in some sterile environment that cost twice as much just to have lackeys follow me around asking me if I need anything.

description: Oceanfront in the heart of Miami Beach’s Art Deco District and South Beach’s finest location. Authentic deco restoration, directed by our owners and embraced by our hand-selected staff providing cordial hospitality. Features 100 Guestrooms: offering all-white bedding, down comforters, Art Deco decor and unique 1930’s-inspired alarm clock with safes, bathrobe and iron/ironing board. Services include: heated swimming pool, Verandah Dining Terrace, WiFi, satellite television and Valet parking, rooftop Terrace and Solarium, business center and Fitness Center.
